title: Tamago Kake Gohan (Japanese-Style Egg Rice)
full_text:
Tamago Kake Gohan (Japanese-Style Egg Rice)
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Active
3 mins
Total
10 mins
Serves
1 serving
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1
cup
hot
cooked white rice
(about
12
ounces
cooked rice;
340
g
)
1
large
egg
(plus
1
optional egg yolk
)
1/2
teaspoon
soy sauce
, plus more to taste
1/2
teaspoon
mirin
(optional)
Pinch
kosher salt
, plus more to taste
Pinch
MSG powder
, such as Aji-no-moto or Accent (optional)
Pinch
Hondashi
(optional; see notes)
Furikake
to taste (optional; see notes)
Thinly sliced or torn
nori
to taste (optional)
Directions
Place rice in a bowl and make a shallow indentation in the center. Break the whole egg into the center. Season with 1/2 teaspoon soy sauce, 1/2 teaspoon mirin (if using), a pinch of salt, a pinch of MSG (if using), and a pinch of Hondashi (if using).
Serious Eats / J. Kenji López-Alt
Stir vigorously with chopsticks to incorporate egg; it should become pale yellow, frothy, and fluffy in texture. Taste and adjust seasonings as necessary.
Serious Eats / J. Kenji López-Alt
Sprinkle with furikake and nori (if using), make a small indentation in the top, and add the other egg yolk (if using). Serve immediately.
Serious Eats / J. Kenji López-Alt
Notes
Hondashi is
powdered dashi
that can be found in any Japanese market and most well-stocked supermarkets. Furikake is a seasoning mixture typically made with seaweed, dried sweetened bonito, and sesame seeds, among other ingredients. It can be found in any Japanese market.
Eggs
Japanese
Dairy-free Breakfast & Brunch
Vegetarian Breakfast & Brunch
White Rice
